entry.text: API LDAP Registry

entry.name: admin_state_apildapregistry_help_364
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_apildapregistry_descr_364
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_apildapregistry_help_365
entry.text: A descriptive summary for the API LDAP registry.

entry.name: summary_apildapregistry_descr_365
entry.text: Enter a brief descriptive summary for the API LDAP registry.

entry.name: ldap_host_apildapregistry_help_366
entry.text: Specifies the host name or IP address of the LDAP server.

entry.name: ldap_host_apildapregistry_descr_366
entry.text: Host name or IP address of the the LDAP server

entry.name: ldap_port_apildapregistry_help_367
entry.text: Specifies the listening port on the LDAP server. The default value is 636.

entry.name: ldap_port_apildapregistry_descr_367
entry.text: The listening port on the LDAP server

entry.name: ssl_client_apildapregistry_help_368
entry.text: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and the LDAP server.

entry.name: ssl_client_apildapregistry_descr_368
entry.text: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and the LDAP server.

entry.name: ldap_version_apildapregistry_help_369
entry.text: Select the LDAP protocol version to use for the bind operation. The default value is v3.

entry.name: ldap_version_apildapregistry_descr_369
entry.text: Version of the LDAP protocol for bind

entry.name: ldap_auth_method_apildapregistry_help_370
entry.text: Indicates how to create the user for authentication. Select #b#Compose DN#/b# when the DN can be composed from the user name. For example, uid=john,ou=People,dc=company,dc=com is a DN format that can be composed from the user name. Select #b#Compose UPN#/b# when the UPN can be composed from the user name. For example, as john@example.com is a UPN format that can be composed from the user name. Select #b#Search DN#/b# when the DN cannot be composed from the user name and an LDAP search is required to retrieve information that matches the user name. By default, queries the LDAP server to retrieve user information. Before deciding on the method, contact your LDAP administrator.

entry.name: ldap_auth_method_apildapregistry_descr_370
entry.text: Method to create the user for authentication.

entry.name: ldap_bind_dn_apildapregistry_help_371
entry.text: Specifies the DN to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

entry.name: ldap_bind_dn_apildapregistry_descr_371
entry.text: Distinguished name to bind to the LDAP server

entry.name: ldap_bind_password_alias_apildapregistry_help_372
entry.text: Specifies the password alias of the LDAP administrator password to bind to the LDAP server for the LDAP search.

entry.name: ldap_bind_password_alias_apildapregistry_descr_372
entry.text: Password alias of the LDAP administrator password

entry.name: ldap_search_param_apildapregistry_help_373
entry.text: Specifies the LDAP search parameters to perform an LDAP search to retrieve the user DN.

entry.name: ldap_search_param_apildapregistry_descr_373
entry.text: The parameters for the LDAP search

entry.name: ldap_readtimeout_apildapregistry_help_374
entry.text: Specifies the time to wait for a response from the LDAP server before the DataPower Gateway closes the LDAP connection. Enter a value in the range 0 - 86400. The default value is 60. A value of 0 indicates that the connection never times out.

entry.name: ldap_readtimeout_apildapregistry_descr_374
entry.text: Time to wait for a response from LDAP server before closing the connection

entry.name: ldap_group_auth_enabled_apildapregistry_help_375
entry.text: Indicates whether to enable LDAP group authentication to use to check group membership for a user. The default value is off.

entry.name: ldap_group_auth_enabled_apildapregistry_descr_375
entry.text: Whether to enable LDAP group authentication

entry.name: ldap_group_auth_type_apildapregistry_help_376
entry.text: Indicates the type of group authentication configuration to use. The default value is static.

entry.name: ldap_group_auth_type_apildapregistry_descr_376
entry.text: The LDAP group authentication type

entry.name: ldap_group_scope_apildapregistry_help_377
entry.text: The depth of the LDAP group search. The default value is subtree.

entry.name: ldap_group_scope_apildapregistry_descr_377
entry.text: The LDAP group scope

entry.name: ldap_group_base_dn_apildapregistry_help_378
entry.text: Specifies the base distinguished (DN) name to begin the group authentication search. This value identifies the entry level of the tree used by the LDAP group scope.

entry.name: ldap_group_base_dn_apildapregistry_descr_378
entry.text: LDAP Group base distinguished name

entry.name: ldap_group_filter_prefix_apildapregistry_help_379
entry.text: Specifies the prefix of the LDAP group filter expression. An LDAP group filter expression is composed by prefix + user DN + suffix . When the prefix is (&(objectclass=group)(member= and the user DN is CN=bob,DN=ibm,DN=com , the LDAP search filter is (&(objectclass=group)(member=CN=bob,DN=ibm,DN=com)) .

entry.name: ldap_group_filter_prefix_apildapregistry_descr_379
entry.text: The LDAP group search filter prefix

entry.name: ldap_group_filter_suffix_apildapregistry_help_380
entry.text: Specifies the suffix of the LDAP group filter expression. When the prefix is &(objectclass=group)(member= , the user DN is CN=bob,DN=ibm,DN=com , and the suffix is )(CN=ibm-group)) , the LDAP search filter is (&(objectclass=group)(member=CN=bob,DN=ibm,DN=com)(CN=ibm-group)) .

entry.name: ldap_group_filter_suffix_apildapregistry_descr_380
entry.text: The LDAP group search filter suffix

entry.name: ldap_group_dynamic_filter_apildapregistry_help_381
entry.text: Specifies the filter expression of the LDAP dynamic group configuration. Only for dynamic. When the filter is (memberOf=CN=ibm-group,DC=ibm,DC=com) , the value is used verbatim for LDAP group dynamic search.

entry.name: ldap_group_dynamic_filter_apildapregistry_descr_381
entry.text: The LDAP group dynamic filter

entry.name: assembly_kglobalconfig_help_384
entry.text: An assembly specifies the API rule to apply to the API call and how to handle errors during the assembly execution. The API rule for the assembly comprises only assembly actions that are executed in order to control a specific aspect of processing such as data transformation during API call at run time. When an API is identified for the incoming request, its assembly is executed.

entry.name: assembly_kglobalconfig_descr_384
entry.text: Assembly

entry.name: admin_state_assembly_help_385
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_assembly_descr_385
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_assembly_help_386
entry.text: A descriptive summary for the assembly configuration.

entry.name: summary_assembly_descr_386
entry.text: Enter a brief descriptive summary for the assembly configuration.

entry.name: rule_assembly_help_387
entry.text: Specifies the API rule that comprises only assembly actions to apply to the API call.

entry.name: rule_assembly_descr_387
entry.text: The API rule to apply to the API call

entry.name: catch_assembly_help_388
entry.text: Specifies how to handle a specific error when it occurs during the assembly execution.

entry.name: catch_assembly_descr_388
entry.text: How to handle a specific error in the assembly

entry.name: default_catch_assembly_help_389
entry.text: Specifies how to handle errors that are not caught by the catch setting during the assembly execution.

entry.name: default_catch_assembly_descr_389
entry.text: How to handle errors that are not caught by the catch setting

entry.name: finally_assembly_help_390
entry.text: Specifies the final API rule to apply to the API call after the main rule, catch rule, or both have finished executing. The final API rule comprises only assembly actions.

entry.name: finally_assembly_descr_390
entry.text: The final API rule to apply to the API call

entry.name: assembly_function_kglobalconfig_help_391
entry.text: An assembly function augments the actions performed by the API Gateway. You can implement an assembly function in one of the following ways. Define an assembly function to add custom logic to an assembly. After you define the assembly function, you can add it to an assembly function call action. When you configure the API Connect Gateway Service as not V5 compatible, use assembly functions to specify user-defined policies that API Connect advertises and makes available in the API Connect assembly editor. User-defined policies provide custom processing control of APIs in the Gateway server. For an assembly function that is intended to be used as a user-defined policy in the API Connect Gateway Service configuration, it is recommended to configure the assembly function using a mechanism other than a configuration file processed by a configuration sequence. Objects created using configuration files are not persisted to the domain startup configuration.

entry.name: assembly_function_kglobalconfig_descr_391
entry.text: Assembly Function

entry.name: audit_log_settings_kglobalconfig_help_399
entry.text: The audit log settings control the configuration of the audit log of the system. The audit log configuration can be specified to keep a number of rotations of a specific size. This object also controls the level of audit. When set to full level of audit, connection information will be logged. More information is logged when in Common Criteria Compliance mode.

entry.name: audit_log_settings_kglobalconfig_descr_399
entry.text: Audit Log Settings

entry.name: admin_state_auditlog_help_400
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_auditlog_descr_400
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: size_auditlog_help_401
entry.text: Specify the maximum size of audit log rotations. Enter a value in the range 250 through 500000. The default value is 1000.

entry.name: size_auditlog_descr_401
entry.text: Maximum log size

entry.name: rotate_auditlog_help_402
entry.text: Specify the maximum number of rotations to permit. Enter a value in the range 1 through 100. The default value is 3.

entry.name: rotate_auditlog_descr_402
entry.text: Maximum number of rotations

entry.name: audit_level_auditlog_help_403
entry.text: Specify the level of audit. Full includes all incoming connection information.

entry.name: audit_level_auditlog_descr_403
entry.text: Desired level of audit

entry.name: b2b_cpa_kglobalconfig_descr_404
entry.text: B2B CPA

entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_b2bcpa_descr_405
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_b2bcpa_descr_406
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: cpa_id_b2bcpa_help_407
entry.text: For outbound transactions, indicates the CPA ID in the outbound ebXML message that you send to the external partner. For inbound transactions, indicates the CPA ID that you use to identify the inbound ebXML message. It is recommended that the CPA ID be a URI.

entry.name: cpa_id_b2bcpa_descr_407
entry.text: CPA ID

entry.name: b2b_cpa_collaboration_kglobalconfig_descr_408
entry.text: B2B CPA Collaboration

entry.name: admin_state_b2bcpacollaboration_help_409
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_409
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_410
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: internal_role_b2bcpacollaboration_help_411
entry.text: Specifies the authorized role, such as "buyer", of the internal party in particular Business Collaboration. When sending an outbound message, the Internal Role is used as the Role element of the From Party; when receiving an inbound message, the Internal Role is used to authorize the Role element of the To Party. Required for a Business Collaboration. Imported from CPA the Role/@name value under the selected internal party. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Role/@name value of the To party when receiving an incoming ebMS message or of the From party when sending an outbound ebMS message.

entry.name: internal_role_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_411
entry.text: Role of internal party

entry.name: external_role_b2bcpacollaboration_help_412
entry.text: Specifies the authorized role, such as "seller", of the external party in particular Business Collaboration. When sending an outbound message, the External Role is used as the Role element of the To Party; when receiving an inbound message, the External Role is used to authorize the Role element of the From Party. Required for a Business Collaboration. Imported from CPA the Role/@name value under the external party. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Role/@name value of the From party in the received incoming ebMS message or of the From party in the outbound ebMS message to be sent.

entry.name: external_role_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_412
entry.text: Role of external party

entry.name: service_b2bcpacollaboration_help_414
entry.text: The required Service identifies the service that acts on the message. For outbound message, the value of the Service is used as the value of the Service element in the ebXML Message Header. For inbound transaction, the Service along with CPAId, Internal Partner, and External Partner are used to identify the CPA Entry; the Service value of Collaboration and the Action value of Action binding then provide routing of received message to correct endpoint. Imported from CPA the Service element under ServiceBinding element. Correspondence between CPA and ebMS message header: Service element.

entry.name: service_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_414
entry.text: Value of service

entry.name: service_type_b2bcpacollaboration_help_415
entry.text: If the type is specified, the value will be present in the type attribute of the Service element within the message being sent. If the type is empty, the value of the Service element should be a URI. Imported from CPA the type attribute within the Service element.

entry.name: service_type_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_415
entry.text: Type attribute of service

entry.name: sender_msh_setting_b2bcpacollaboration_help_416
entry.text: Specifies the default sender action binding within the MSH Signal Service Collaboration in which the Service attribute is valued "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service". This identifies the deafult setting for sending standalone MSH level signals (i.e., Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, Pong). The default can be overridden by Action entry. Created by referencing to the defaultMshChannelId of both parties when CPA import.

entry.name: sender_msh_setting_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_416
entry.text: Default setting for sending ebMS MSH level signals

entry.name: receiver_msh_setting_b2bcpacollaboration_help_417
entry.text: Specifies the default receiver action binding within the MSH Signal Service Collaboration in which the Service attribute is valued "urn:oasis:names:tc:ebxml-msg:service". This identifies the deafult setting for receiving standalone MSH level signals (i.e., Acknowledgment, Error, StatusRequest, StatusResponse, Ping, Pong). The default can be optionally overridden by the receiver action entry which is named as the MSH level signal identifier. Created by referencing to the defaultMshChannelId of both parties when CPA import.

entry.name: receiver_msh_setting_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_417
entry.text: Default setting for receiving ebMS MSH level signals

entry.name: action_b2bcpacollaboration_help_418
entry.text: Defines the actions to bind. For a business Collaboration, each Action entry identifies an business message that a Party is capable of sending or receiving. For a Collaboration of MSH level signal, override the sending or receiving behaviors of default sender setting or default receiver setting using the value of "Acknowledgment", "MessageError", "StatusRequest", "StatusResponse", "Ping", or "Pong". Created when importing a CPA and are configurable.

entry.name: action_b2bcpacollaboration_descr_418
entry.text: Actions

entry.name: cpa_receiver_setting_kglobalconfig_descr_419
entry.text: CPA Receiver Setting

entry.name: admin_state_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_420
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_420
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_421
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: local_uri_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_422
entry.text: Specifies the URI where messages can be received. Implied by CPA the Endpoint element of the internal (receiving) party's TransportReceiver element. If the value is specified, then the incoming URI received by the Frontside Handler should match the pattern specified otherwise the transaction will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender.

entry.name: local_uri_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_422
entry.text: URI to receive the message

entry.name: syncreply_mode_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_423
entry.text: Specifies the type of sync reply mode the receiver expects. The value of "none", which is the default value, indicates that all MSH level and Business level messages will be returned as separate asynchronous messages. The value other than "none" indicates the synchronous connection will be used to exchange all messages necessary for conducting the business transaction. Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's syncReplyMode attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element. If the value configured is not identical to the implied mode requested by the received ebMS message, for example, the value is "none" but a SyncReply element is present in the received ebMS message header, the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender.

entry.name: syncreply_mode_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_423
entry.text: Sync reply mode the receiver expects

entry.name: ack_requested_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_424
entry.text: Used by the receiver to control whether to expect the incoming message to request an Acknowledgment. If the value is set to "always" (or "never"), then the AckRequested element should (not) be present within the MessageHeader element in the ebMS SOAP Header otherwise it will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender. If the value is set to "perMessage", then it means whether the AckRequested element is present or absent can be varied on a "per message" basis and the receiving gateway will return an Acknowledgment signal if requested. Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

entry.name: ack_requested_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_424
entry.text: Whether the receiver expects request for Acknowledgment

entry.name: ack_signature_requested_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_425
entry.text: Used by the receiver to control whether to expect the incoming message to request a signed Acknowledgment. If the value is set to "always" (or "never"), then the signed attribute within the AckRequested element should be set to "true" (or "false") otherwise it will fail and the gateway will attempt to report the error to the sender. If the value is set to "perMessage", then it means the receiving gateway will sign the Acknowledgment if requested. Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

entry.name: allow_dup_msg_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_426
entry.text: Controls when to allow and reprocess duplicate AS or ebMS inbound messages. Note that this option does not apply to MDN or ACK.

entry.name: allow_dup_msg_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_426
entry.text: When to allow and reprocess duplicate inbound messages

entry.name: persist_duration_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_427
entry.text: Indicates to the receiving gateway the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage. When receiving inbound message, the Persist Duration is used to compute the expiry time using the formula: Time to Persist = Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's expiry time has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation. Default to 0 to expire the received document at the time we receive the document. Imported from CPA, the PersistDuration element within ReliableMessaging element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding element.

entry.name: persist_duration_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_427
entry.text: Duration of message to be persisted

entry.name: encrypt_required_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_428
entry.text: Controls whether the body of received ebMS messages should be encrypted. The default is off. Note that this option is not applied for the MSH level signals which is not to be encrypted. Implied by CPA the isConfidential attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.

entry.name: encrypt_required_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_428
entry.text: Whether the incoming message should be encrypted

entry.name: decrypt_idcred_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_429
entry.text: Sets the identification credentials to decrypt inbound messages. Created when importing a CPA. Please set the correct identification credentials after import.

entry.name: decrypt_idcred_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_429
entry.text: Identification credentials used to decrypt inbound messages

entry.name: sign_required_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_430
entry.text: Controls whether the received ebMS messages should be signed. The default is off. Implied by CPA the isNonRepudiationRequired attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.

entry.name: sign_required_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_430
entry.text: Whether the incoming message should be signed

entry.name: verify_valcred_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_431
entry.text: Sets the validation credentials to verify inbound messages' signature. Imported from CPA. If the isNonRepudiationReceiptRequired is set true, the SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.

entry.name: verify_valcred_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_431
entry.text: Validation credentials used to verify inbound message

entry.name: default_signer_cert_b2bcpareceiversetting_help_432
entry.text: Set the default validation certificate to verify the signature of an inbound ebMS message or an acknowledgment. The default signature validation certificate is used if either keyInfo element is missing or signature method is not supported.

entry.name: default_signer_cert_b2bcpareceiversetting_descr_432
entry.text: Default validation certificate used to verify the signature of inbound message

entry.name: cpa_sender_setting_kglobalconfig_descr_433
entry.text: CPA Sender Setting

entry.name: admin_state_b2bcpasendersetting_help_434
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_434
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_435
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: enabled_doc_type_b2bcpasendersetting_help_436
entry.text: Indicates which document types to support.

entry.name: enabled_doc_type_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_436
entry.text: Enabled Document Type

entry.name: dest_url_b2bcpasendersetting_help_437
entry.text: Specify the destination URL for sending the message to the external party's endpoint. The URL is parsed to determine the protocol to use. If the URL starts with http:// , the service uses the HTTP protocol. If the URL starts with https:// , the service uses the HTTPS protocol. Imported from CPA the Endpoint element for the external party's TransportReceiver element. To use a load balancer, specify the name of an existing Load Balancer Group instead of the address-port pair in the URL.

entry.name: dest_url_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_437
entry.text: Destination URL

entry.name: ssl_b2bcpasendersetting_help_438
entry.text: Sets the TLS proxy profile to establish an TLS-enabled, secured connection. Imported from CPA, the TransportServerSecurity element provides details about establishing the secure connection between the sender and receiver.

entry.name: ssl_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_438
entry.text: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an TLS client profile.

entry.name: username_b2bcpasendersetting_help_439
entry.text: Overrides the user name in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses. The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.

entry.name: username_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_439
entry.text: User name

entry.name: password_b2bcpasendersetting_help_440
entry.text: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses. The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.

entry.name: password_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_440
entry.text: Password

entry.name: password_alias_b2bcpasendersetting_help_441
entry.text: Overrides the password for the user in the basic authentication policy for the user agent that the B2B gateway uses. The setting for HTTP Basic Authorization is not imported from CPA.

entry.name: password_alias_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_441
entry.text: Password Alias

entry.name: timeout_b2bcpasendersetting_help_442
entry.text: Specifies the maximum number of seconds to maintain an idle connection. Use any value of 3 - 7200. The default is 300. This setting is not imported from CPA.

entry.name: timeout_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_442
entry.text: Override timeout

entry.name: syncreply_mode_b2bcpasendersetting_help_443
entry.text: Specifies the type of synchronous response requested by the message which is being sent. The value of "none", which is the default value, indicates that all MSH level and Business level messages will be returned as separate asynchronous messages. For the value of "mshSignalsOnly", the ebMS's SyncReply element will be included in the SOAP Header of the outbound message. Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's syncReplyMode attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

entry.name: syncreply_mode_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_443
entry.text: Type of synchronous response

entry.name: duplicate_elimination_b2bcpasendersetting_help_444
entry.text: When sending an outbound ebMS message, this option controls whether the internal sending party requests the external receiving party to check duplicate elimination. If set to "always", the default value, the request for duplicate elimination will be made by presenting the DuplicateElimination element within the MessageHeader element in the ebMS SOAP Header. Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's duplicateElimination attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element.

entry.name: duplicate_elimination_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_444
entry.text: Whether to request duplicate elimination

entry.name: ack_requested_b2bcpasendersetting_help_445
entry.text: Used by the sending party to control whether to request the receiving MSH to return the Acknowledgment signal. If set to "always", then the AckRequested element within the MessageHeader element in the SOAP Header is to be present. Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element. As a sender the possible value is "always" (enabled) or "never" (disabled).

entry.name: ack_requested_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_445
entry.text: Whether to request an Acknowledgment

entry.name: ack_signature_requested_b2bcpasendersetting_help_446
entry.text: Used by the sending party to control whether the receiving MSH should return a signed Acknowledgment signal - containing a Signature element. If set to "always", then the message being sent outbound will have the signed attribute of the AckRequested element set to "true". Imported from CPA the internal party's DeliveryChannel's ackSignatureRequested attribute within the MessagingCharacteristics element. As a sender the possible value is "always" (enabled) or "never" (disabled).

entry.name: ack_signature_requested_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_446
entry.text: Whether to request signed Acknowledgment

entry.name: retry_b2bcpasendersetting_help_447
entry.text: Controls whether to enable the logic for the retransmission of unacknowledged outbound messages. The default is off. Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.

entry.name: retry_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_447
entry.text: Whether to retransmit an unacknowledged message

entry.name: max_retries_b2bcpasendersetting_help_448
entry.text: Specifies the permitted number of retransmission of a message. Use an integer between 1 through 30. The default is 3, which means an outbound message can potentially be sent four times (the initiative one and successive 3 retries). Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.

entry.name: max_retries_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_448
entry.text: Maximum number of retries

entry.name: retry_interval_b2bcpasendersetting_help_449
entry.text: Specifies the interval in seconds between retry attempts. Use any value of 1 - 86400. This default is 1800. Imported from CPA, described by the ebXMLSenderBinding element's ReliableMessaging element.

entry.name: retry_interval_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_449
entry.text: Time interval of each retry attempt

entry.name: persist_duration_b2bcpasendersetting_help_450
entry.text: Indicates to the sending gateway the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage and is used to compute the TimeToLive value to be packaged in the outbound message. When sending outbound message, the TimeToLive is computed using the formula: with Retry, Current Time + ((Maximum Retries + 2) * Retry Interval); without Retry, Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's TimeToLive has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation. Default to 0 to expire the sent document at the time it is being sent. Imported from CPA, the PersistDuration element within ReliableMessaging element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding element.

entry.name: persist_duration_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_450
entry.text: Duration of message to be persisted

entry.name: include_time_to_live_b2bcpasendersetting_help_451
entry.text: Controls whether the sending partner includes the <TimeToLive> element in the outbound ebMS message header. The <TimeToLive> element indicates when the message expires. If the receiving partner receives the message before it expires, the receiving partner accepts the message. If the receiving partner receives the message after it expires, the receiving partner rejects the message.

entry.name: include_time_to_live_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_451
entry.text: Lifetime of the message

entry.name: encrypt_required_b2bcpasendersetting_help_452
entry.text: Controls whether to encrypt the body of outgoing ebMS messages. The default is off. This encryption is not applied for the MSH level signals. Implied by the CPA element SenderDigitalEnvelope under DocExchange element's ebXMLSenderBinding.

entry.name: encrypt_required_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_452
entry.text: Whether to encrypt messages

entry.name: encrypt_cert_b2bcpasendersetting_help_453
entry.text: Sets the certificate that encrypts outbound messages. Use the name of a certificate. Imported from CPA, the EncryptionCertificateRef which is within the DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding/ReceiverDigitalEnvelope of the other party to point to what the other (external receiving) Party's encryption certificate to be applied.

entry.name: encrypt_cert_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_453
entry.text: Certificate used to encrypt outbound messages

entry.name: encrypt_algorithm_b2bcpasendersetting_help_454
entry.text: Sets the encryption algorithm that encrypts outbound ebMS messages. Imported from CPA the EncryptionAlgorithm element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding identifies the encryption algorithm to be used.

entry.name: sign_required_b2bcpasendersetting_help_455
entry.text: Controls whether to digitally sign the messages being sent from this internal partner. The default is off. Implied by CPA the isNonRepudiationRequired attribute within this party action binding's BusinessTransactionCharacteristics element.

entry.name: sign_required_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_455
entry.text: Whether to sign message being sent

entry.name: sign_idcred_b2bcpasendersetting_help_456
entry.text: Sets the identification credentials used by this internal party to digitally sign an outbound message being sent and the MSH level signals being responded from this internal partner when requiring a signature. Created when importing a CPA. Set the correct identification credentials after import.

entry.name: sign_idcred_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_456
entry.text: Credentials used to sign outbound messages and the MSH signal response.

entry.name: sign_algorithm_b2bcpasendersetting_help_457
entry.text: Sets the algorithm used to sign messages from this internal partner. The default is dsa-sha1 recommended by the ebMS specification. Imported from CPA. The SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.

entry.name: sign_algorithm_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_457
entry.text: Signature algorithm

entry.name: sign_digest_algorithm_b2bcpasendersetting_help_458
entry.text: Sets the algorithm used to hashing the payloads during signing. The default is sha1. Refer to http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/. Imported from CPA. If the isNonRepudiationReceiptRequired is set true, the SenderNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLSenderBinding and the ReceiverNonRepudiation element under DocExchange/ebXMLReceiverBinding describe the parameters related to the implementation of non-repudiation of origin - which includes the signing certificate, signature algorithm, the hashing algorithm, etc.

entry.name: sign_digest_algorithm_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_458
entry.text: Digest algorithm used in the XML Signature when hashing the payloads during signing

entry.name: sign_c14n_algorithm_b2bcpasendersetting_help_459
entry.text: Sets the algorithm used to canonicalize the SOAP Envelope XML and exclude comments before signing messages. The default is Canonical XML 1.0with Comments, which is recommended by the ebMS specification. Not imported from CPA but is required when Require Signature is set to true.

entry.name: sign_c14n_algorithm_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_459
entry.text: Signature canonicalization algorithm used before signing process

entry.name: ssl_client_type_b2bcpasendersetting_help_460
entry.text: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

entry.name: ssl_client_type_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_460
entry.text: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets

entry.name: ssl_client_b2bcpasendersetting_help_461
entry.text: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

entry.name: ssl_client_b2bcpasendersetting_descr_461
entry.text: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets

entry.name: b2bgw_kglobalconfig_help_462
entry.text: The configuration for a B2B gateway instance. A B2B gateway can handle B2B messages transmitted over a variety of AS and non-AS protocols for inbound and outbound flows, as well as MDN messages.

entry.name: b2bgw_kglobalconfig_descr_462
entry.text: B2B Gateway

entry.name: admin_state_b2bgateway_help_463
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_b2bgateway_descr_463
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_b2bgateway_descr_464
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: priority_b2bgateway_help_465
entry.text: Control the service scheduling priority. When system resources are in high demand, "high" priority services will be favored over lower priority services.

entry.name: priority_b2bgateway_descr_465
entry.text: Service scheduling priority

entry.name: doc_location_b2bgateway_help_466
entry.text: The URL to save copies of inbound documents, outbound documents, and intermediate documents that might be needed for retransmission. The location can be an NFS mount or an iSCSI server (deprecated), which stores documents off of the appliance. However, iSCSI locations cannot be set from the WebGUI. To use an NFS mount, select the NFS mount point. The list shows these mount points in the nfs- name : format, where name is the name of the NFS static mount. To use an iSCSI mount (deprecated), configure and initialize an iSCSI volume. Because the iSCSI volume is mounted in the local: directory, use the local:/// directory format, where directory is the value defined by the directory property while in the iSCSI Volume configuration. If unspecified, these documents are stored in the encrypted area on the RAID volume. If using this location, set the maximum disk use to 30 gigabytes.

entry.name: doc_location_b2bgateway_descr_466
entry.text: Storage location for documents

entry.name: as_fsph_b2bgateway_help_467
entry.text: The front side protocol handlers to assign to the B2B gateway. Handlers determine the network communication protocol, address communication protocol, address, port, and other protocol-specific settings.

entry.name: as_fsph_b2bgateway_descr_467
entry.text: Front Side Protocol Handlers

entry.name: as1_mdn_email_b2bgateway_help_468
entry.text: For asynchronous MDN scenarios, the default e-mail address to send an AS1 asynchronous MDN. When sending outbound AS1 e-mail messages that request an MDN, this e-mail address can be used as the default e-mail address to send the response MDN. An e-mail address in the destination overrides this value.

entry.name: as1_mdn_email_b2bgateway_descr_468
entry.text: Default e-mail address for AS1 asynchronous MDN

entry.name: as1_mdn_smtp_server_connection_b2bgateway_help_469
entry.text: When an incoming AS1 message requests an MDN be sent as an e-mail request, the SMTP server connection describes how to send the MDN response to the specified e-mail address.

entry.name: as1_mdn_smtp_server_connection_b2bgateway_descr_469
entry.text: SMTP server connection to send asynchronous MDN responses

entry.name: as2_mdn_url_b2bgateway_help_470
entry.text: For asynchronous MDN scenarios, an explicit MDN URL can be provided for AS2 protocol. It can point to gateway itself or a firewall or proxy service that will eventually route the message back to gateway. If the firewall or proxy between the external partner and the appliance does not forward the MDN to the appliance, the B2B gateway will keep retransmitting the message to the external partner. This property can be overridden in the destination configuration for the external partner.

entry.name: as2_mdn_url_b2bgateway_descr_470
entry.text: Default URL for AS2 asynchronous MDN

entry.name: as3_mdn_url_b2bgateway_help_471
entry.text: For AS3 asynchronous MDN scenarios, an explicit MDN URL can be provided for AS3 protocol. It can point to gateway itself or a firewall or proxy service that will eventually route the message back to gateway. If the firewall or proxy between the external partner and the appliance does not forward the MDN to the appliance, the B2B gateway will keep retransmitting the message to the external partner. This property can be overridden in the destination configuration for the external partner.

entry.name: as3_mdn_url_b2bgateway_descr_471
entry.text: Default URL for AS3 asynchronous MDN

entry.name: b2b_profile_b2bgateway_help_472
entry.text: Assigns B2B Partner Profile objects to the gateway.

entry.name: b2b_profile_b2bgateway_descr_472
entry.text: Active partner profiles

entry.name: b2b_group_b2bgateway_help_473
entry.text: Assigns B2B Partner Profile Groups objects to the gateway.

entry.name: b2b_group_b2bgateway_descr_473
entry.text: Active profile groups

entry.name: document_routing_preprocessor_type_b2bgateway_help_474
entry.text: Specifies the file type of the document routing preprocessor to run against messages that are not received through AS or ebMS protocols. The default value is stylesheet.

entry.name: document_routing_preprocessor_type_b2bgateway_descr_474
entry.text: File type of document routing preprocessor

entry.name: document_routing_preprocessor_b2bgateway_help_475
entry.text: Specifies the location of a stylesheet or a GatewayScript file, based on the processor type, to run against transactions that cannot be handled by B2B-specific handlers. A stylesheet examines information from transport headers and other non-content sources to select relevant trading partners. The default stylesheet is store:///b2b-routing.xsl . A GatewayScript examines information from transport headers and payloads to select relevant trading partners. A Gatewayscript can parse messages of different data types, such as JSON, XML, and non-XML. A sample GatewayScript file is store:///gateayscript/example-b2b-routing.js .

entry.name: document_routing_preprocessor_b2bgateway_descr_475
entry.text: Location of the document routing preprocessor file

entry.name: document_routing_preprocessor_debug_b2bgateway_help_476
entry.text: Specifies whether to enable the GatewayScript debugger to detect and diagnose errors in your document routing preprocessor file. To debug a file, make sure that the file contains one or more debugger; statements at the points in your script where you want to start debugging.

entry.name: document_routing_preprocessor_debug_b2bgateway_descr_476
entry.text: Whether to enable GatewayScript debugger for document routing preprocessor

entry.name: arch_mode_b2bgateway_help_477
entry.text: Indicates whether to perform archive operations before removing messages.

entry.name: arch_mode_b2bgateway_descr_477
entry.text: Archive mode

entry.name: arch_dir_b2bgateway_help_478
entry.text: Specifies the URL of the directory that contains archive files. Use the fully qualified name of the directory. The supported off-device protocol schemes are: HTTP (http://) and HTTPS (https://), NFS (dpnfs://), FTP and FTPS (ftp://), and SFTP (sftp://). To store locally in RAID volume, specify a subdirectory in the configured Hard Disk Array; for example, local:///ondisk. The message archive is in Binary. When archiving to an FTP (or FTPS) destination, ensure that the FTP policies in the associated XML manager enable "Image (Binary) Data" for data transfer.

entry.name: arch_dir_b2bgateway_descr_478
entry.text: Location of the message archive

entry.name: arch_file_b2bgateway_help_479
entry.text: Specifies the base file name for archive files. When archiving, the archive operation appends the current timestamp.

entry.name: arch_file_b2bgateway_descr_479
entry.text: Base file name

entry.name: arch_minimum_size_b2bgateway_help_480
entry.text: Specifies the minimum size of the document store before triggering the archive operation. The default is 1024.

entry.name: arch_minimum_size_b2bgateway_descr_480
entry.text: Minimum size

entry.name: arch_document_age_b2bgateway_help_481
entry.text: Specifies the maximum duration to retain processed documents. After exceeding this duration, automatically archive or purge processed documents. Use any value of 1 - 3650. The default is 90.

entry.name: arch_document_age_b2bgateway_descr_481
entry.text: Maximum age of processed documents

entry.name: arch_minimum_documents_b2bgateway_help_482
entry.text: Specifies the minimum number of documents to retain in the document store at the end of an archive operation. The minimum is 1. The default is 100.

entry.name: arch_minimum_documents_b2bgateway_descr_482
entry.text: Minimum number of documents to retain

entry.name: diskuse_check_interval_b2bgateway_help_483
entry.text: Sets the interval between checks for documents that exceed the maximum age. During the check, documents that exceed the maximum age are archived or purged. Use any value of 1 - 1440. The default is 60.

entry.name: diskuse_check_interval_b2bgateway_descr_483
entry.text: Interval between checks

entry.name: max_diskuse_b2bgateway_help_484
entry.text: Specifies the maximum storage size for documents. When storage exceeds this value, documents are archived or purged. The default is 25165824.

entry.name: max_diskuse_b2bgateway_descr_484
entry.text: Maximum storage for documents

entry.name: arch_monitor_b2bgateway_help_485
entry.text: The monitor can limit the message injection rate to prevent archive problems in a critical situation like performance testing or on a heavily loaded device. When enabled, specify the threshold for the archive monitor in the #b#Threshold for Archive Monitor#/b# field.

entry.name: arch_monitor_b2bgateway_descr_485
entry.text: Whether to use a monitor for the archive task

entry.name: arch_shaping_threshold_b2bgateway_help_486
entry.text: Specifies the maximum number of transactions to allow per second during the archive task. When the maximum number is reached, the service queues incoming transactions for later processing. If the queue is full, the service rejects incoming transactions and generates a log message. Use any value in the range 10 - 10000. The default value is 200.

entry.name: arch_shaping_threshold_b2bgateway_descr_486
entry.text: Threshold for archive monitor in transactions per second

entry.name: arch_backup_documents_b2bgateway_help_487
entry.text: Specifies which type of documents to back up. The transaction viewer lists four types of documents: Content, Input, Output, and MDN/ACK/Receipt. Inbound Message, Outbound Message, and Inbound and outbound MDN/ACK/Receipt correspond to "Input", "Output", and "MDN/ACK/Receipt" respectively. This property does not indicate the inbound or outbound transaction to archive, instead, the property indicates the file type to archive. When the Inbound MDN/ACK/Receipt or Outbound MDN/ACK/Receipt is selected, the DataPower Gateway archives the MDN/ACK/Receipt message documents. When none of four AS/ebMS2/ebMS3 document types are selected, the DataPower Gateway does not archive any type of message documents for any transactions.

entry.name: arch_backup_documents_b2bgateway_descr_487
entry.text: Types of document to back up

entry.name: xpath_routing_b2bgateway_help_488
entry.text: Specifies the set of policies to extract partner identifiers from XML EDI messages.

entry.name: xpath_routing_b2bgateway_descr_488
entry.text: XPath Routing Policy

entry.name: xml_manager_b2bgateway_help_489
entry.text: The XML manager to manage the DataPower service. The XML manager contains the reference to a user agent. The user agent defines the default settings for how the service connects to external services.

entry.name: xml_manager_b2bgateway_descr_489
entry.text: XML Manager

entry.name: debug_mode_b2bgateway_help_490
entry.text: Select the diagnostic mode for processing policies. When enabled, you can view details about the state of variables and contexts for a captured transaction in the probe. The default value is off . Transaction diagnostic mode is not intended for use in a production environment. Transaction diagnostic mode consumes significant resources that can slow down transaction processing.

entry.name: debug_mode_b2bgateway_descr_490
entry.text: Controls transaction diagnostic mode

entry.name: debug_history_b2bgateway_help_493
entry.text: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe. Enter a value in the range 10 - 250. The default value is 25.

entry.name: debug_history_b2bgateway_descr_493
entry.text: Set the number of records for transaction diagnostic mode in the probe

entry.name: cpa_entry_b2bgateway_help_494
entry.text: Each CPA entry binds an ebXML messaging service (ebMS) to provide partnership interactions between the internal partner and the external partner. If the message is sent by or to the external partner through an ebMS communication protocol (ebms2:// or ebms2s://), specify #b#CPA ID#/b#, #b#Service#/b#, #b#Internal Partner Profile#/b#, and #b#External Partner Profile#/b# to identify the received ebMS message or route the ebMS message to be sent. You can ping ebMS destination to send an ebMS ping message to the external partner, and requests a synchronous or an asynchronous pong message. The response can be: #b#Success#/b#: The connection to the external partner is successful. #b#Unexpected Error#/b#: An error occurs when getting the pong message. Go to #b#View Logs#/b# from the Control Panel for details about the error. If you request an asynchronous pong message, the timeout for getting the response is 30 seconds. If you do not get any response after 30 seconds, go to #b#View Logs#/b# from the Control Panel to find the response in the system log.

entry.name: cpa_entry_b2bgateway_descr_494
entry.text: CPA Entries

entry.name: sql_source_b2bgateway_help_495
entry.text: The SQL Data Source object that is associated with current B2B gateway. For transactions using IBM MQFTE destination, IBM MQFTE transfer metadata can be retrieved by clicking the integration ID from B2B viewer as long as IBM MQFTE logger is enabled and this SQL data source object is configured correctly to connect to the database which stores IBM MQFTE transfer metadata. It is recommended that all transactions within one B2B gateway that utilize IBM MQFTE front side handler or IBM MQFTE URL opener should use the same database as IBM MQFTE logger backend database because only one SQL data source object can be associated per B2B gateway.

entry.name: sql_source_b2bgateway_descr_495
entry.text: SQL Data Source

entry.name: front_side_timeout_b2bgateway_help_496
entry.text: Controls the amount of time when a front side client connection can be idle before the connection is canceled within a transaction. For a B2B outbound transaction, a front side connection means the connection between an internal back-end application and a B2B gateway. For aB2B inbound transaction, a front side connection means the connection between an external partner and a B2B gateway

entry.name: front_side_timeout_b2bgateway_descr_496
entry.text: The idle time allowed for a front side connection before the connection is canceled during a transaction.

entry.text: Data storage for B2B transaction data

entry.name: b2b_persistence_kglobalconfig_descr_497
entry.text: B2B Persistence

entry.name: admin_state_b2bpersistence_help_498
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_b2bpersistence_descr_498
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_b2bpersistence_descr_499
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: raid_volume_b2bpersistence_help_500
entry.text: Specifies the location of the persistent data store. The location must be the raid0 RAID volume. During firmware initialization, the raid0 volume is associated with persistent storage.

entry.name: raid_volume_b2bpersistence_descr_500
entry.text: Location of the data store

entry.name: storage_size_b2bpersistence_help_501
entry.text: Sets the maximum size for the persistent data store in megabytes. This data store is for all B2B Gateway services. These services store transaction metadata on the unencrypted partition of the RAID volume. These services store copies of the messages on the encrypted portion of the RAID volume. The storage location for messages is defined on a service-by-service basis during the configuration of the B2B Gateway object. #b#Attention:#/b# The maximum size for the persistent data store cannot be changed to a smaller value. Changing to a larger value might interrupt transactions that are in flight. Use an integer in the range 1024 - 65536. The default is 1024.

entry.name: storage_size_b2bpersistence_descr_501
entry.text: Maximum size for the data store

entry.name: ha_enabled_b2bpersistence_help_502
entry.text: When on, the appliance is in active-passive high availability mode with the configured 'Alternate Host'.

entry.name: ha_enabled_b2bpersistence_descr_502
entry.text: Enables high availability configuration

entry.name: ha_other_hosts_b2bpersistence_help_503

entry.name: ha_other_hosts_b2bpersistence_descr_503

entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: profile_type_b2bprofile_help_510
entry.text: Whether the profile is for an internal or external partner. The default value is internal.

entry.name: profile_type_b2bprofile_descr_510
entry.text: Type of trading partner

entry.name: business_id_b2bprofile_help_511
entry.text: Specifies the identifier for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, its identifier (ID) must be unique within a specific B2B Gateway configuration. The identifiers for the trading partner should be equivalent to one of the following values. In AS messages, a value for an AS*-From or AS*-To header, where * is 1, 2, or 3. In ebMS messages, a value for an PartyID element, where the PartyID element can be under either From or To element. In none of above, a value that is extracted from the body of the EDI message: SenderID or ReceiverID .

entry.name: business_id_b2bprofile_descr_511
entry.text: Identifiers for the partner

entry.name: business_id_duns_b2bprofile_help_512
entry.text: Specifies the 9-digit D-U-N-S (Data Universal Numbering System) identification number for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, the identifier (ID) should be unique not only within the 3 types of ID System (Freeform, DUNS, and DUNS+4) but also within a specific B2B Gateway configuration.

entry.name: business_id_duns_b2bprofile_descr_512
entry.text: Identifiers for the partner by DUNS Number

entry.name: business_id_duns4_b2bprofile_help_513
entry.text: Specifies the 13-digit D-U-N-S (Data Universal Numbering System + 4) identification number for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, the identifier (ID) should be unique not only within the 3 types of ID System (Freeform, DUNS, and DUNS+4) but also within a specific B2B Gateway configuration.

entry.name: business_id_duns4_b2bprofile_descr_513
entry.text: Identifiers for the partner by DUNS+4 Number

entry.name: stylepolicy_b2bprofile_help_514
entry.text: Select a Document Processing Policy that controls processing actions against submitted messages.

entry.name: stylepolicy_b2bprofile_descr_514
entry.text: Customer processing policy

entry.name: response_type_b2bprofile_help_515
entry.text: Characterizes the traffic that originates from 'To' partner. For inbound transaction, this is the traffic type that originates from internal partner. For outbound transaction, this is the traffic type that originates from external partner. The default value is Non-XML.

entry.name: response_type_b2bprofile_descr_515
entry.text: Characterize response traffic

entry.name: email_address_b2bprofile_help_516
entry.text: The identifier (e-mail address) for the partner. When configuring a trading partner, its e-mail address must be unique within a specific B2B Gateway configuration. The e-mail addresses for the trading partner should be equivalent to one of the following values: In AS1 messages, a value for a From or To header In non-AS1 messages, a value that is extracted from the body of the EDI message: SenderID or ReceiverID .

entry.name: email_address_b2bprofile_descr_516
entry.text: E-mail addresses for the partner in AS1 To or From headers

entry.name: destination_b2bprofile_help_517
entry.text: Defines routing information for the partner. The first destination is the default destination. The gateway uses the default destination when no specific destination is assigned or when no matching destination is found.

entry.name: destination_b2bprofile_descr_517
entry.text: Destinations

entry.name: require_signed_b2bprofile_descr_519
entry.text: Whether to require a signature

entry.name: require_encrypted_b2bprofile_help_520
entry.text: Indicates whether inbound AS messages to this internal partner must be encrypted. If requiring encryption (on), set the identification credentials to decrypt inbound messages. The default behavior is off.

entry.text: Whether to require encryption

entry.text: Identification credentials set

entry.name: mdn_ssl_b2bprofile_help_522
entry.text: Sets the TLS proxy profile to establish a TLS-enabled, secured connection to external partners who request asynchronous MDNs sent to HTTPS addresses. This TLS proxy profile will be used for all HTTPS addresses in the inbound Receipt-Delivery-Option header. To specify a TLS proxy profile for specific URLs, configure a user agent for the XML manager associated with the gateway.

entry.name: mdn_ssl_b2bprofile_descr_522
entry.text: The MDN TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an MDN TLS client profile.

entry.name: sign_b2bprofile_help_523
entry.text: Controls whether to sign outbound messages from this internal partner. The default behavior is off. If enabled, signs outbound messages with the configured identification credentials and algorithm. If the configuration of a destination indicates to send messages unsigned, messages from this partner to that destination will not be signed. If disabled, does not sign outbound messages. This setting has no effect on outbound MDN messages. Regardless of this setting and if a partner requests a signed MDN, the outbound MDN is signed if this partner has a configured identification credentials.

entry.name: sign_b2bprofile_descr_523
entry.text: Whether to sign outbound messages

entry.name: sign_idcred_b2bprofile_help_524
entry.text: Sets the identification credentials set to sign an outbound message or outbound MDN from this internal partner when requiring a signature. The outbound MDN is signed if requested by a partner and this setting is configured.

entry.name: sign_idcred_b2bprofile_descr_524
entry.text: Credentials to sign outbound messages, and if requested, MDN messages.

entry.name: sign_digest_alg_b2bprofile_help_525
entry.text: Sets the hash algorithm for the signature on an outbound message from this internal partner when requiring a signature.

entry.name: sign_digest_alg_b2bprofile_descr_525
entry.text: Hash algorithm

entry.name: sign_micalg_version_b2bprofile_help_526
entry.text: Specifies the S/MIME specification version to generate the desired format of "micalg" parameter values in a multipart/signed message. The following one is a sample Content-Type header of the multipart/signed message: Content-Type: multipart/signed;protocol="application/pkcs7-signature";micalg=sha1; boundary=... The "micalg" parameter indicates which message digest algorithm (such as, MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, and SHA-512) is used in the calculation of the Message Integrity Check (MIC). The formats of the micalg value differ between S/MIME Version 3.1 (RFC 3851) and Version 3.2 (RFC 5751). In Version 3.1, the micalg parameter value has micalg=[md5|sha1|sha256|sha384|sha512]. In Version 3.2, the micalg parameter value has micalg=[md5|sha-1|sha-256|sha-384|sha-512].

entry.name: sign_micalg_version_b2bprofile_descr_526
entry.text: Which S/MIME version's micalg parameter value format to use

entry.name: contact_b2bprofile_help_527
entry.text: Specifies the contact information for the partner. To define the contact information, you must provide information for at least one of the properties.

entry.name: contact_b2bprofile_descr_527
entry.text: Contact information

entry.name: override_as_identifier_b2bprofile_help_528
entry.text: Overrides the identifiers for the partner in AS message headers. For outbound messages, the value to use for the AS*-From or AS*-To header, where * is 1, 2, or 3. If blank, the transaction retains the identifiers that were extracted from the message payload. For inbound messages, the value becomes another valid identifier for the partner in addition to those already defined for the partner.

entry.name: override_as_identifier_b2bprofile_descr_528
entry.text: Override AS identifier

entry.name: as_allow_dup_msg_b2bprofile_help_529
entry.text: Controls when to allow and reprocess duplicate AS inbound messages. The default behavior is never. This option does not apply to MDN.

entry.name: as_allow_dup_msg_b2bprofile_descr_529
entry.text: When to allow and reprocess duplicate AS inbound messages

entry.name: preserve_filename_b2bprofile_help_530
entry.text: According to RFC 2183, the file name information is optional in Content-Disposition header. When enabled, the Content-Disposition header of the inbound AS message is exposed if the inbound AS message is in S/MIME format. Then, the receiving partner can retrieve the original file name that is contained in the header and transfer the received file to its backend system with the received file name.

entry.name: preserve_filename_b2bprofile_descr_530
entry.text: Whether to expose the Content-Disposition header of inbound AS messages for filename preservation

entry.name: ebms_role_b2bprofile_help_531
entry.text: Specifies the name of authorized role of the party. When sending outbound message, the role associated with internal partner presents the From party and the role associated with external partner presents the To party, respectively. The value is referencing to the Role specified in CPA. A Role is better defined as a URI, for example, http://rosettanet.org/roles/buyer.

entry.name: ebms_role_b2bprofile_descr_531
entry.text: Name of role

entry.name: ebms_persist_duration_b2bprofile_help_532
entry.text: The time, which can be obtained from a CPA, indicates to the receiving partner the minimum length of time the message should be kept in persistent storage. When receiving inbound message, the Persist Duration is used to compute the expiry time using the formula: Time to Persist = Persist Duration + Current Time. When a message is not expired, it is not eligible to be archived; once a message's expiry time has elapsed, the message will be archivable when performing archive operation. Default to 0 to expire the received document at the time we receive the document.

entry.name: ebms_persist_duration_b2bprofile_descr_532
entry.text: Duration of message to be persisted

entry.name: ebms_ack_url_b2bprofile_help_533
entry.text: Specifies the redirection URL where to send the Acknowledgment message when received ebMS2 message requests for asynchronous response. When an asynchronous reply is requested by the inbound ebMS2 document, this field is required to determine where to send the acknowledgment. Though optional, it is recommended to set the URL.

entry.name: ebms_ack_url_b2bprofile_descr_533
entry.text: Redirection URL for sending an asynchronous ebMS2 Acknowledgment Message

entry.name: ebms_error_url_b2bprofile_help_534
entry.text: Specifies the redirection URL where to report the Error message when received ebMS2 message requests for asynchronous response. When an asynchronous reply is requested by the inbound ebMS2 document, this field is used as the error reporting location to send the error message - which contains the error code such as MimeProblem, and the description of the problem - when any problem occurs. Error URL should not be empty if the Acknowledgment URL is specified.

entry.name: ebms_error_url_b2bprofile_descr_534
entry.text: Redirection URL for sending an asynchronous ebMS2 Error Message

entry.name: ebms_inbound_send_receipt_b2bprofile_help_535
entry.text: Controls whether to reply to the sending MSH with a receipt signal message for the received ebMS messages. The default behavior is off.

entry.name: ebms_inbound_send_receipt_b2bprofile_descr_535
entry.text: Whether to reply with a receipt

entry.name: ebms_inbound_send_signed_receipt_b2bprofile_help_536
entry.text: Controls whether to reply to the sending MSH with a signed receipt signal message for the received ebMS3 message. The default behavior is off.

entry.name: ebms_inbound_send_signed_receipt_b2bprofile_descr_536
entry.text: Whether to reply with signed receipt

entry.name: ebms_inbound_receipt_reply_pattern_b2bprofile_help_537
entry.text: Specifies the pattern to send the receipt signal. The default behavior is response.

entry.name: ebms_inbound_receipt_reply_pattern_b2bprofile_descr_537
entry.text: Specify the pattern to send the receipt signal.

entry.name: ebms_receipt_url_b2bprofile_help_538
entry.text: When the receipt reply pattern is callback, specify the URL to send the receipt signal to.

entry.name: ebms_receipt_url_b2bprofile_descr_538
entry.text: Receipt URL

entry.name: ebms_inbound_error_url_b2bprofile_help_539
entry.text: When the error is sent asynchronously, specify the URL to send the error signal to.

entry.name: ebms_inbound_error_url_b2bprofile_descr_539
entry.text: Error URL

entry.text: Sets the validation credentials set to verify the signature on an Acknowledgment or inbound ebMS2 message from this external partner. For ebMS2 messages, the DataPower Gateway supports only X509Data and KeyName signature methods.

entry.name: ebms_verify_valcred_b2bprofile_descr_540

entry.name: ebms_default_signer_cert_b2bprofile_help_541

To specify a TLS proxy profile for specific URLs, configure a user agent for the XML manager associated with the gateway.

entry.name: ebms_ack_ssl_b2bprofile_descr_542

entry.text: Indicates whether inbound ebMS2 messages to this internal partner must be signed. The default behavior is off.

entry.name: ebms_require_signed_b2bprofile_descr_543
entry.text: Whether to require a signature

entry.text: Indicates whether inbound ebMS2 messages to this internal partner must be encrypted. If requiring encryption (on), set the identification credentials to decrypt inbound ebMS2 messages. The default behavior is off.

entry.text: Whether to require encryption

entry.name: ebms_decrypt_idcred_b2bprofile_help_545
entry.text: Sets the identification credentials set to decrypt inbound ebMS2 messages to this internal partner when requiring encryption.

entry.name: ebms_decrypt_idcred_b2bprofile_descr_545
entry.text: Identification credentials set

entry.name: ebms_sign_b2bprofile_help_546
entry.text: Controls whether to sign outbound messages from this internal partner. The default behavior is off. If enabled, signs outbound messages with the configured identification credentials and algorithm. If the configuration of a destination indicates to send messages unsigned, messages from this partner to that destination will not be signed. If disabled, does not sign outbound messages. This setting has no effect on outbound Acknowledgment messages. Regardless of this setting and if a partner requests a signed Ack, the outbound Acknowledgment is signed if this partner has a configured identification credentials.

entry.name: ebms_sign_b2bprofile_descr_546
entry.text: Whether to sign outbound messages

entry.name: ebms_sign_idcred_b2bprofile_help_547
entry.text: Sets the identification credentials set to sign an outbound message or outbound Acknowledgment from this internal partner when requiring a signature. The outbound Acknowledgment is signed if requested by a partner and this setting is configured. For ebMS2 messages, the DataPower Gateway supports only X509Data and KeyName signature methods.

entry.text: Credentials to sign outbound messages, and if requested, Acknowledgment messages

entry.name: ebms_signature_alg_b2bprofile_help_548
entry.text: Sets the algorithm used to sign the outbound ebMS2 message from this internal partner. The default value is dsa-sha1, which is recommended by the ebMS specification.

entry.name: ebms_signature_alg_b2bprofile_descr_548

entry.name: ebms_signature_c14n_alg_b2bprofile_help_549
entry.text: Sets the algorithm used to canonicalize the SOAP Envelope XML and exclude comments before signing outbound ebMS2 message. The default value is c14n, which is recommended by the ebMS specification.

entry.name: ebms_signature_c14n_alg_b2bprofile_descr_549
entry.text: Signature canonicalization algorithm used before signing outbound message

entry.name: ebms_sign_digest_alg_b2bprofile_help_550
entry.text: Sets the algorithm used to hashing the payloads during signing. The default value is sha1. See http://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/

entry.name: ebms_sign_digest_alg_b2bprofile_descr_550
entry.text: Digest algorithm used in the XML Signature when hashing the payloads during signing.

entry.name: ebms_enable_cpa_bindings_b2bprofile_help_551
entry.text: When enabled, the CPA, service, and action that are specified by the matched CPA binding are used for the outbound ebMS2 messages instead of the default CPA, service, and action of the external profile. The CPA binding is matched by the internal partner profile.

entry.name: ebms_enable_cpa_bindings_b2bprofile_descr_551
entry.text: Whether to enable CPA bindings

entry.name: profile_cpa_binding_b2bprofile_help_552
entry.text: Specifies the CPA binding that you prefer to use to the external partner profile. A CPA binding binds a CPA entry (CPA, service, and action) that you prefer to use. When a CPA entry is matched through the internal partner profile, outbound messages from the internal partner use the CPA, service, and action that are specified by the matched CPA entry. You must have defined the CPA entry in the ebXML settings of the associated B2B Gateway before you add the entry to the CPA bindings list.

entry.name: profile_cpa_binding_b2bprofile_descr_552
entry.text: CPA Bindings

entry.name: ebms_cpa_id_b2bprofile_help_553
entry.text: Sets the CPAId to be packaged in the outbound ebMS2 message header. This value is the default CPA ID to use when the B2B Gateway is CPA-enforced.

entry.name: ebms_service_b2bprofile_help_554

entry.name: ebms_action_b2bprofile_help_555

entry.name: ebms_start_parameter_b2bprofile_help_556
entry.text: Indicates whether to generate a start parameter for the ebMS2 message. The start parameter identifies the root part of the ebMS message. This setting is disabled by default. If enabled, the DataPower Gateway generates a start parameter with its value enclosed in angle brackets.

entry.name: wxs_grid_kglobalconfig_help_594
entry.text: The configuration of an eXtreme Scale Grid defines the connection details to an eXtreme Scale grid in an eXtreme Scale collective. To define this configuration, you must define the eXtreme Scale collective, the grid name, and the user and password for the user account who connects to the eXtreme Scale. If you need to secure connections to eXtreme Scale, you must assign a TLS Proxy Profile.

entry.name: wxs_grid_kglobalconfig_descr_594
entry.text: eXtreme Scale Grid

entry.name: username_wxsgrid_help_599

You can use all alphanumeric characters and most special characters. You cannot use spaces or the following special characters: # < . The user must have sufficient eXtreme Scale permissions to access the grid.

entry.name: cloud_connector_kglobalconfig_help_625
entry.text: Creates a Cloud Connector service, which is a type of TLS forwarder. This service can be used with a Cloud Gateway Service to secure traffic from cloud-based clients to enterprise applications. This service requires a TLS proxy profile that defines the connections for secure communication. You must use TLS between the Cloud Connector and its Cloud Gateway, otherwise connection establishment will fail. If the TLS proxy profile is defined as forward, the data is secured toward the Cloud Gateway, but is not secured toward the client. If the TLS proxy profile is defined as reverse, the connection will fail. If the TLS proxy profile is defined as two way, the data is secured in both directions.

entry.name: cloud_connector_kglobalconfig_descr_625
entry.text: Cloud Connector Service

The default value is 0.

entry.name: cloud_gateway_kglobalconfig_help_639
entry.text: Cloud Gateway services are used with IBM Cloud Integration Services to secure traffic from cloud-based applications to enterprise applications or data sources. The Cloud Gateway service requires a TLS proxy profile that defines the secure communication from the cloud into the enterprise network or DMZ. You must use TLS between the cloud-based client and its Cloud Gateway, and you must define the TLS proxy profile as reverse, otherwise the connection establishment fails. The TLS proxy profile references a Crypto Profile that includes both Identification Credentials and Validation Credentials. The Identification Credentials provide the private key and certificate that is associated with the gateway, and the Validation Credentials provide the certificate from the cloud. There can be multiple cloud certificates in the gateway's Validation Credentials, which allow multiple clouds to connect to a single gateway. Each Cloud Gateway service must have one or more enterprise applications defined. When a cloud-based client establishes a connection to a Cloud Gateway service, the client identifies which enterprise application to connect to using the service name.

entry.name: cloud_gateway_kglobalconfig_descr_639
entry.text: Cloud Gateway Service
