entry.name: source_amqp_kglobalconfig_help_2523
entry.text: In AMQP, distributed source and target termini are managed by a broker. The broker periodically monitors and polls termini. The broker ensures that sent messages are directed to the correct target terminus or are routed to another server. The AMQP broker configuration on the DataPower Gateway corresponds to an AMQP broker that is running on another host in the network.

entry.name: source_amqp_kglobalconfig_descr_2523
entry.text: AMQP Handler

entry.name: admin_state_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2524
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2524
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2525
entry.text: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.

entry.name: summary_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2525
entry.text: Brief descriptive summary for the configuration

entry.name: broker_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2526
entry.text: Select an AMQP broker from the list.

entry.name: broker_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2526
entry.text: AMQP broker name

entry.name: from_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2527
entry.text: Specify the name of the terminus to retrieve the message that might be the reply to a posted message.

entry.name: from_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2527
entry.text: Name of the source terminus to retrieve the message

entry.name: to_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2528
entry.text: Specify the name of the target terminus to post the message.

entry.name: to_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2528
entry.text: Name of the target terminus to post the message

entry.name: maximum_message_size_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2529
entry.text: Specify the maximum message size in bytes. EEnter a value in the range 0 - 104857600. The default value is 0, which indicates to use the value set in the referenced AMQP broker.

entry.name: maximum_message_size_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2529
entry.text: Maximum message size to allow

entry.name: credit_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2530
entry.text: Specify the number of concurrent messages that a receiver can handle. The minimum value is 1. The default value is 10.

entry.name: credit_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2530
entry.text: Number of concurrent messages that a receiver can handle

entry.name: ignore_reply_to_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_help_2531
entry.text: Indicate whether to ignore the AMQP reply-to property. The default value is on. When enabled, ignores the reply-to address when sending an AMQP response message. When disabled, uses the reply-to address instead of the address of the target terminus.

entry.name: ignore_reply_to_amqpsourceprotocolhandler_descr_2531
entry.text: Whether to ignore the AMQP reply-to property

entry.name: source_as2_proxy_kglobalconfig_help_2532
entry.text: A MEIG AS2 proxy handler receives AS2 requests over HTTP or HTTPS and forwards them to the back end which is assumed to be an IBM Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway (MEIG) server. AS2 proxy handlers conform to gateway specifications of RFC 2616 and AS2 specification of RFC 4130.

entry.name: source_as2_proxy_kglobalconfig_descr_2532
entry.text: MEIG AS2 Proxy Handler

entry.name: admin_state_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2533
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2533
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2534
entry.text: A descriptive summary for the configuration.

entry.name: summary_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2534
entry.text: Enter a descriptive summary for the configuration.

entry.name: local_address_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2535
entry.text: Specifies the address to listen on for incoming HTTP traffic. The default value indicates that the service listens on all IP addresses.

entry.name: local_address_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2535
entry.text: Enter the IP address or host alias on which the service listens.

entry.name: port_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2536
entry.text: Specifies the port to listen on for incoming HTTP traffic. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 80.

entry.name: port_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2536
entry.text: The local TCP port number that supports server operations

entry.name: http_client_version_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2537
entry.text: Select the HTTP version for client side connections. The default value is HTTP 1.1.

entry.name: http_client_version_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2537
entry.text: HTTP version for client side connections

entry.name: allowed_features_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2538
entry.text: Specifies the methods and versions to allow for incoming HTTP requests.

entry.name: allowed_features_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2538
entry.text: Methods and versions to allow for incoming requests

entry.name: persistent_connections_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2539
entry.text: Indicates whether to negotiate persistent connections where appropriate on the front end. The default value is enabled.

entry.name: persistent_connections_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2539
entry.text: Whether to negotiate persistent connections on the front end

entry.name: max_persistent_reuse_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2540
entry.text: Specifies the maximum number of times a persistent connection is reused on the front end. When the maximum reuse count is reached, an explicit HTTP Connection: close header is sent in the response and the TCP connection is closed. The default value is 0, which means unlimited reuse.

entry.name: max_persistent_reuse_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2540
entry.text: The maximum number of times a persistent connection is reused on the front end

entry.name: compression_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2541
entry.text: Whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections. The default value is off. If enabled, the DataPower service uses GZIP to compress HTTP transmissions when the Accept-Encoding HTTP header indicates that compressed documents can be processed. The Transfer-Encoding HTTP header indicates compression.

entry.name: compression_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2541
entry.text: Indicate whether to negotiate GZIP compression for client side connections.

entry.name: max_url_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2542
entry.text: Specifies the length of the longest incoming URL to accept. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. Enter a value in the range 1 - 128000. The default value is 16384.

entry.name: max_url_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2542
entry.text: The length of the longest incoming URL to accept

entry.name: max_total_header_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2543
entry.text: Specifies the maximum aggregate length of incoming HTTP headers to allow. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

entry.name: max_total_header_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2543
entry.text: Maximum aggregate length of incoming HTTP headers to allow

entry.name: max_header_count_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2544
entry.text: Specifies the maximum number of headers to allow in the incoming request messages. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_count_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2544
entry.text: Maximum number of headers to allow in HTTP requests

entry.name: max_header_name_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2545
entry.text: Specifies the maximum length of HTTP header names. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting specifies the maximum length of the name portion for HTTP headers. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_name_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2545
entry.text: Maximum length of the name part of an HTTP header

entry.name: max_header_value_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2546
entry.text: Specifies the maximum length of HTTP header values to allow. Each HTTP header is expressed as a name-value pair. This setting specifies the maximum length of the value portion of that header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_value_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2546
entry.text: Maximum length of the value part of an HTTP header

entry.name: max_querystring_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2547
entry.text: The portion of the URL after the question mark (?) is known as the query string. This property specifies its maximum length in bytes. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_querystring_len_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2547
entry.text: Maximum length of the HTTP query string to allow

entry.name: acl_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2548
entry.text: Specifies the access control list to allow or deny access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an access control list denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

entry.name: acl_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2548
entry.text: The access control list to allow or deny access to this service

entry.name: credential_charset_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2549
entry.text: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value is Protocol, which represents ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

entry.name: credential_charset_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2549
entry.text: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values

entry.name: ssl_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2550
entry.text: Specifies a TLS proxy profile for securing the communication between the requesting client and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2550
entry.text: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.

entry.name: remote_hostname_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2551
entry.text: Specifies the IP address, host name, or name of a load balancer group of the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: remote_hostname_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2551
entry.text: IP address, host name, or load balancer group name of the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: remote_port_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2552
entry.text: Specifies the destination port on the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: remote_port_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2552
entry.text: Destination port on the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: remote_ssl_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2553
entry.text: Specifies a TLS proxy profile for securing the communication between the DataPower Gateway and the remote Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: remote_ssl_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2553
entry.text: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.

entry.name: remote_connect_timeout_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2554
entry.text: Specifies the number of seconds that the DataPower Gateway waits to establish a connection to the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server. Enter a value in the range 1 - 86400. The default value is 60.

entry.name: remote_connect_timeout_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2554
entry.text: Connection timeout

entry.name: xml_manager_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2555
entry.text: Specifies an existing XML manager. An XML manager obtains and manages XML documents, stylesheets, and other document resources on behalf of one or more services.

entry.name: xml_manager_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2555
entry.text: An XML manager

entry.name: enable_passthrough_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2556
entry.text: Controls whether to pass the original AS2 requests to the processing policy of DataPower service. When enabled, the AS2 proxy handler passes the original AS2 requests to DataPower service processing policy. When disabled, the AS2 proxy handler first uses the cryptographic information in the partner exchange profile to decrypt the incoming AS2 requests and verify the signature. The AS2 proxy handler then passes the decrypted request body with signature removed to DataPower service for processing.

entry.name: enable_passthrough_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2556
entry.text: Whether to pass the original AS2 requests to DataPower service processing policy

entry.name: enable_visibility_event_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2557
entry.text: Controls whether to send the visibility events generated by the AS2 proxy handler to the MEIG visibility event endpoint. These visibility events are correlated to those generated by the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server in one transaction thread.

entry.name: enable_visibility_event_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2557
entry.text: Whether to send visibility events to the MEIG visibility event endpoint

entry.name: visibility_event_endpoint_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2558
entry.text: Specifies the URL of the MEIG visibility event endpoint. Enter the URL in the format of static IBM MQ URL that provides the information about the IBM MQ server name, queue manager name, and name of the channel configured in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server. For example, dpmq://NAME_OF_MQ_OBJECT/?RequestQueue=QUEUE_NAME_FOR_VISIBILITY_EVENT

entry.name: visibility_event_endpoint_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2558
entry.text: The location of the MEIG visibility event endpoint

entry.name: enable_hmac_authentication_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2559
entry.text: Controls whether to use Hash-based Message Authentication Code (HMAC) to secure all visibility events sent to the visibility event endpoint. If HMAC is enabled in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server, you must enable HMAC authentication in the AS2 proxy handler to avoid message rejection.

entry.name: enable_hmac_authentication_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2559
entry.text: Whether to use HMAC to secure visibility event delivery

entry.name: hmac_passphrase_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2560
entry.text: Specifies the passphrase used to calculate the HMAC token for message authentication and integrity check in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: hmac_passphrase_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2560
entry.text: HMAC passphrase

entry.name: hmac_passphrase_alias_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2561
entry.text: Specifies the password alias of the passphrase used to calculate the HMAC token for message authentication and integrity checking in the Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: hmac_passphrase_alias_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2561
entry.text: HMAC passphrase alias

entry.text: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.text: Set the TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: ssl_client_type_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_help_2565
entry.text: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and the remote Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server. This communication must be TLS protected. You can define the TLS proxy profile for this communication in one of the following places: Define the TLS profile in the user agent that is assigned to the XML manager for the DataPower service service. Define the TLS profile here. Ensure that the TLS profile is defined in one of these places. Without the remote TLS profile, processing is stopped and an error is logged.

entry.name: ssl_client_type_as2proxysourceprotocolhandler_descr_2565
entry.text: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and the remote Multi-Enterprise Integration Gateway server.

entry.name: address_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2592
entry.text: Enter the address on which the FTP server service listens. The default value is 0.0.0.0, which indicates that the service is active on all addresses. You can use a local host alias to help ease migration. If the FTP server service is listening on a virtual IP address managed by a standby control group with the self-balancing feature enabled, incoming control and data connections will always go to the active member of the standby control group.

entry.name: address_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2592
entry.text: Local IP address

entry.name: port_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2593
entry.text: Enter the port that is monitored by the FTP Server service. This port is the port on which FTP control connections can be established. This port does not control the TCP port that is used for the data connections. If the FTP client uses the PASV command, data connections will use an arbitrary, unused TCP port. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 21.

entry.name: port_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2593
entry.text: Local TCP port for the FTP server

entry.name: filesystem_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2594
entry.text: Select the file system type that is presented by the FTP server. If virtual ephemeral or virtual persistent is chosen, the client can write files to all directories. These files are shown in directory listings but cannot be retrieved. For file system responses, the responses are shown and can be retrieved, renamed, and deleted by the client. If transparent is chosen, the file system shows the contents of the equivalent path of the server on the back-end of the Multi-Protocol Gateway with which this FTP server is associated.

entry.name: filesystem_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2594
entry.text: The type of file system the FTP server will present

entry.name: persistent_filesystem_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2595
entry.text: Enter the duration in seconds that a connection to a virtual file system is retained after all FTP control connections from user identities are disconnected. When the timeout expires, the virtual file system object is destroyed. All of the response files that were not deleted by the FTP client are deleted from their storage area. Enter a value in the range 1 - 43200. The default value is 600.

entry.name: persistent_filesystem_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2595
entry.text: Controls how long a virtual persistent file system with no active connections is retained

entry.name: virtual_directory_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2596
entry.text: In virtual mode, create a directory in the virtual file system that is presented by this FTP server. The FTP client can use all of these directories to write file to be processed. The root directory (/) is always present and cannot be created. Its response directory is always the root directory.

entry.name: virtual_directory_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2596
entry.text: Create directory in virtual file system of FTP server

entry.name: default_directory_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2597
entry.text: Enter the initial working directory on the FTP server (after users connect and authenticate). When using a virtual file system and the working directory is not the root directory, the specified directory must be one of the configured virtual directories. The default is the root directory (/).

entry.name: default_directory_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2597
entry.text: Default for current working directory

entry.name: max_filename_len_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2598
entry.text: Enter the maximum file name length on the FTP server. Enter a value in the range 1 - 4000. The default value is 256.

entry.name: max_filename_len_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2598
entry.text: Maximum length of a file name on the server

entry.name: acl_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2599
entry.text: Select an access control list to apply. The ACL allows or denies access to the FTP server based on the IP address of the FTP client.

entry.name: require_tls_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2600
entry.text: Specify whether FTP control connections require TLS encryption. For implicit or explicit FTP, you must complete the configuration by specifying the TLS profile to secure the connection.

entry.name: require_tls_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2600
entry.text: Control whether FTP control connections require TLS encryption

entry.name: ssl_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2601
entry.text: Specify an TLS proxy profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2601
entry.text: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use an TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.

entry.name: password_aaa_policy_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2602
entry.text: Select the AAA policy to perform authentication of user names and passwords provided to the FTP server by the client with the USER and PASS commands. If the authentication succeeds, the FTP client may use all the features of the FTP server. If the authentication fails, a 530 error is returned, and the user can attempt to authenticate again. Without this AAA policy, any user name and password will be accepted.

entry.name: password_aaa_policy_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2602
entry.text: AAA policy for validating user name and password

entry.name: certificate_aaa_policy_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2603
entry.text: Selects the AAA policy to perform secondary authentication of the information provided in the TLS certificate provided during negotiation after the AUTH TLS command to the FTP server. Primary authentication is done by the TLS profile, which can reject a certificate. This authentication stage controls whether an FTP password will be demanded or not. If the result of this authentication succeeds, the FTP client will only have to use the USER command to login after the AUTH TLS. If this authentication fails, the FTP client will have to use both the USER and PASS commands to complete the login process. Without this AAA policy, USER and PASS are required. If the AUTH TLS command is not used by the FTP client, USER and PASS are required.

entry.name: certificate_aaa_policy_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2603
entry.text: AAA policy to determine whether password is required

entry.name: allow_ccc_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2604
entry.text: Specify whether the FTP CCC command can be used to turn off TLS encryption of the FTP control connection after user authentication. If allowed, the CCC command can be used to turn off encryption after authentication. Disabling encryption is necessary when the FTP control connection crosses a firewall or NAT device that needs to sniff the control connection. Disabling encryption eliminates the secrecy of the files being transferred and allows TCP packets injection attacks.

entry.name: allow_ccc_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2604
entry.text: Control use of CCC command

entry.name: passive_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2605
entry.text: Control use of the FTP PASV and EPSV commands by the FTP client, as an alternative to the PORT and EPRT commands. The default is to allow PORT, EPRT, PASV, and EPSV. Other settings either require PASV or EPSV, or require PORT or EPRT. If an acceptable PORT, EPRT, PASV, or EPSV command is not received, the STOR, STOU, RETR, LIST, and NLST data transfer commands will fail. This FTP server will never attempt to connect to the deprecated default FTP data port at TCP port 20.

entry.name: passive_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2605
entry.text: Control use of passive mode

entry.name: passive_port_range_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2606
entry.text: When enabled, when a PASV or EPSV command is received from the FTP client, instead of selecting any free listening TCP port in the range 1024 - 65534, allow configuration of a restricted port range. This may be used when a firewall wants to allow incoming FTP data connections only on a limited range of ports, particularly when it cannot "sniff" the FTP control connection. Note that the size of the range specified limits how many FTP clients can be in the state between receiving the 227 response code to the PASV or EPSV command, and establishing the FTP data TCP connection. Pressure on this limited resource can be controlled by adjusting the passive data connection idle timeout. While it is perfectly legal to configure multiple FTP servers on the same system to use the same (or overlapping) passive port ranges, realize that they are contending for a common resource in the TCP implementation. However, it is not wise to use a port range that overlaps with other services (HTTP servers, etc.) that are configured on the system. There is no configuration checking for such conflicts, and other configured services will allocate the ports first, and they will not be available for the FTP server. The FTP server allocates these listening ports dynamically.

entry.name: passive_port_range_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2606
entry.text: Enable using a limited range of TCP port numbers for passive connections.

entry.name: passive_port_min_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2607
entry.text: Specify the lowest listening TCP port number to use for passive FTP data connections. Any value from 1024 to 65534 is valid, as long as this not greater than maximum passive port.

entry.name: passive_port_min_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2607
entry.text: Lowest port value for the passive port range

entry.name: passive_port_max_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2608
entry.text: Specify the highest listening TCP port number to use for passive FTP data connections. Any value from 1024 to 65534 is valid, as long as this not less than minimum passive port.

entry.name: passive_port_max_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2608
entry.text: Highest port value for the passive port range

entry.name: passive_idle_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2609
entry.text: Specifies the number of seconds that the server waits for a client to establish a passive connection. Enter a value in the range 5 - 300. The default value is 60. This setting controls the amount of time in seconds between when the FTP server issues code 227 (Entering Passive Mode) in response to the PASV or EPSV command from the FTP client and when the FTP client must establish a TCP data connection to the listening port and issue a data transfer command. If the data connection is not established within the timeout period, the listening port will be closed. If a data transfer command is issued after the port is closed, the command fails with code 425 and the Failed to open data connection message. If the data connection is established but no data transfer command is issued within the timeout period, the TCP data connection will be closed. Any data transfer command after the timeout will be treated as if the PASV or EPSV command was never issued. The command fails with code 425 and the Require PASV or PORT command first message.

entry.name: passive_idle_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2609
entry.text: Idle timeout for a passive data connection

entry.name: passive_promiscuous_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2610
entry.text: This option will disable the IP security check that is done when processing the FTP PASV command. The check verifies that the IP address of the client connecting to the data connection is the same as the one that established the control connection. The default value is off, which is the expected behavior for an FTP server. Turn the option on if there is a specific reason the incoming connection will not be coming from the same client as the control connection (i.e. from a load balancer). This configuration property is only supported by the FTP server handler and in conjunction with a Multi-Protocol Gateway or Web Service Proxy.

entry.name: passive_promiscuous_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2610
entry.text: Disable passive data connection (PASV) IP security check

entry.name: port_promiscuous_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2611
entry.text: This option will disable the IP security check that verifies that outgoing data connections can only connect to the client. The default value is off, which is the expected behavior for an FTP server. This configuration property is only supported by the FTP server handler and in conjunction with a Multi-Protocol Gateway or Web Service Proxy.

entry.name: port_promiscuous_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2611
entry.text: Disable active data connection (PORT) IP security check

entry.name: allow_passive_addr_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2612
entry.text: When on, this option will enable the ability to override the IP address that is presented to the FTP client when the server is in passive mode. This configuration property is only supported by the FTP server handler and in conjunction with a Multi-Protocol Gateway or Web Service Proxy.

entry.name: allow_passive_addr_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2612
entry.text: Use alternate PASV IP address

entry.name: passive_addr_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2613
entry.text: The numeric IP address that will be returned to the FTP client in response to a PASV command. This does not change the IP address that the FTP server will listen on, which is always the IP address that the FTP data connection was made to. This is used in certain situations when the FTP server is behind a firewall that is not FTP-aware.

entry.name: passive_addr_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2613
entry.text: Alternate PASV IP address

entry.name: list_cmd_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2614
entry.text: When on, the server will make a distinction between the LIST and NLST commands. When off, the server will always respond with an NLST when requesting a file listing. The default value is off This configuration property is only supported by the FTP server handler and in conjunction with a Multi-Protocol Gateway or Web Service Proxy.

entry.name: list_cmd_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2614
entry.text: Enable LIST command support

entry.name: dele_cmd_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2615
entry.text: When on, allows the DELE (delete) command to be passed to the FTP back-end server. This is only valid in transparent file system type. The default value is off This configuration property is only supported by the FTP server handler and in conjunction with a Multi-Protocol Gateway or Web Service Proxy.

entry.name: dele_cmd_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2615
entry.text: Enable DELE (delete) support

entry.name: data_encryption_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2616
entry.text: Select the use of encryption for data connections (file transfers). Data encryption is controlled by the FTP PROT P command.

entry.name: data_encryption_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2616
entry.text: Control use of data encryption for file transfers

entry.name: allow_compression_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2617
entry.text: Specify whether the FTP client can use FTP MODE Z compression. After enabling FTP compression, the FTP client can use the zlib method to compress data transfers.

entry.name: allow_compression_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2617
entry.text: Control use of MODE Z command to compress data transfer

entry.name: allow_unique_filename_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2618
entry.text: Specify whether the FTP client can use the FTP STOU command. When enabled, the FTP server generates a unique file name for each transferred file.

entry.name: allow_unique_filename_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2618
entry.text: Control use of STOU command for unique file names

entry.name: unique_filename_prefix_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2619
entry.text: Enter the prefix (leading characters) for file names that are generated when using the FTP STOU command. When defining the prefix, the directory separator (/) is not allowed. The default is to not add a prefix, which is an empty string. #b#Note:#/b# The software adds a numeric suffix.

entry.name: unique_filename_prefix_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2619
entry.text: Prefix of all unique filenames generated by STOU

entry.name: allow_restart_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2620
entry.text: Controls whether the FTP client can use the FTP REST command to continue the transfer of a file after an interruption in the data transfer. This is supported in the BSD stream style described in draft-ietf-ftpext-mlst-16.txt. (The MODE B style that is described in RFC 959 is not supported.) The FTP server must be configured with a virtual persistent file system. For written files, the server will delay the actual processing until a timeout expires or until the next FTP command other than a SIZE or REST command. This processing allows the FTP client can return and resume to the transfer using the SIZE, REST, and STOR commands. The argument to the REST command must be the same as the byte count returned by the SIZE command. #b#Note:#/b# The response code to all STOR commands on this server will always be 226. The response codes does not reflect the success of the transaction. This capability is also supported for reading the response files, if the server is configured for a response type of virtual file system. #b#Note:#/b# The generation of response files are delayed until the transaction is completed.

entry.name: allow_restart_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2620
entry.text: Control use of the REST command for interrupted file transfers

entry.name: restart_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2621
entry.text: When restart (REST) is enabled, the number of seconds that the FTP client has to reconnect to the server and use the SIZE, REST, and STOR commands to continue an interrupted file transfer. If this period of time elapses, the data that was received to this point on the TCP data connection will be passed to the Multi-Protocol Gateway. This timeout is canceled if another command (other than SIZE or REST) is received on the FTP control connection.

entry.name: restart_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2621
entry.text: Time that the STOR command waits for a restart

entry.name: idle_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2622
entry.text: Enter the number of seconds that the FTP control connection can be idle. After the specified duration elapses, the FTP server closes the control connection. Defaults to 0, which disables the timeout.

entry.name: idle_timeout_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2622
entry.text: Inactivity limit on FTP control connection

entry.name: response_type_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2623
entry.text: Select how to make response files available for gateway transactions started by an FTP STOR or SOUT operation.

entry.name: response_type_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2623
entry.text: How to make response available to FTP client

entry.name: response_storage_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2624
entry.text: Select where response files are stored.

entry.name: response_storage_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2624
entry.text: Where to store response files

entry.name: filesystem_size_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2625
entry.text: Enter in megabytes the maximum size for the temporary file system size. Enter a value in the range 1 - 2048. The default value is 32.

entry.name: filesystem_size_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2625
entry.text: Maximum size of temporary file system

entry.name: response_nfs_mount_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2626
entry.text: When the response type is virtual file system and response storage is NFS, select an NFS static mount to apply. Each response file will have a unique file name in the NFS directory. The name of the response file is not related to the file name that the virtual file system presents to the FTP client. Generally, this NFS directory is not made available through the FTP server. This directory should not be used for any other purpose.

entry.name: response_nfs_mount_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2626
entry.text: NFS mount to store response files in

entry.name: response_suffix_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2627
entry.text: When the response type is a virtual file system or an FTP client, enter the suffix to add when generating response files. The directory separator (/) is not allowed. If the response type is a virtual file system and the FTP client is writing in virtual directories that do not have a response directory or if the response directory is the same as the virtual directory, this value must have a non-empty value. If empty, the response would try to overwrite the request, which is not allowed. Defaults to an empty string.

entry.name: response_suffix_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2627
entry.text: URL file name suffix to response file

entry.name: response_url_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2628
entry.text: When Response Type is FTP Client, enter the URL to use when generating response files. This URL enables a response to be written using FTP commands. The URL must be an FTP URL that starts with ftp:// . The URL should include a directory, but not a file name. The URL cannot include query parameters. The default is to have no response generated (an empty string).

entry.name: response_url_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2628
entry.text: URL for generating a response via FTP client

entry.name: ssl_config_type_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2629
entry.text: The TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_config_type_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2629
entry.text: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: ssl_server_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2630
entry.text: The TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_server_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2630
entry.text: Set the TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: ssl_sni_server_as3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2631
entry.text: The TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_sni_server_as3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2631
entry.text: Set the TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: source_ebms2_kglobalconfig_help_2632
entry.text: The configuration for an ebMS2 handler.

entry.name: source_ebms2_kglobalconfig_descr_2632
entry.text: ebMS2 Handler

entry.name: admin_state_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2633
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2633
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2634
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: local_address_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2635
entry.text: The address on which the service listens. The default value of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines.

entry.name: local_address_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2635
entry.text: Local IP address

entry.name: port_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2636
entry.text: Specifies the port monitored by the HTTP service. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 80.

entry.name: port_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2636
entry.text: The local TCP port number that supports server operations

entry.name: http_client_version_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2637
entry.text: Select the HTTP version to use on the front (client) side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

entry.name: http_client_version_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2637
entry.text: Front side HTTP version

entry.name: persistent_connections_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2638
entry.text: Controls whether to enable persistent connections on the front side. The default is enabled.

entry.name: persistent_connections_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2638
entry.text: Whether to enable persistent connections

entry.name: compression_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2639
entry.text: Controls whether to enable GZIP compression on the front side. The default is disabled.

entry.name: compression_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2639
entry.text: Whether to enable GZIP compression

entry.name: max_url_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2640
entry.text: An integer in the range 1 to 128000 that specifies the longest incoming URL that is accepted in bytes. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. The default value is 16384.

entry.name: max_url_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2640
entry.text: Longest incoming URL that is accepted

entry.name: max_total_header_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2641
entry.text: Specifies the maximum aggregate size of incoming HTTP headers in bytes. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

entry.name: max_total_header_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2641
entry.text: Maximum aggregate size of incoming headers

entry.name: max_header_count_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2642
entry.text: Specifies the maximum number of headers that is allowed in the request message. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_count_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2642
entry.text: Maximum number of HTTP request headers

entry.name: max_header_name_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2643
entry.text: Each HTTP Header is expressed as a name and value pair. This property specifies the maximum length of the name portion of the header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_name_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2643
entry.text: Maximum length of HTTP header name

entry.name: max_header_value_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2644
entry.text: Each HTTP Header is expressed as a name and value pair. This property specifies the maximum length of the value portion of the header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_value_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2644
entry.text: Maximum length of HTTP header value

entry.name: max_querystring_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2645
entry.text: The maximum length of the query string that is allowed in the client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_querystring_len_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2645
entry.text: Maximum query string length

entry.name: ssl_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2646
entry.text: Select an existing TLS proxy profile from the list to assign the TLS proxy profile to this handler. Click the + button to create a new TLS proxy profile and assign that TLS proxy profile to the handler.

entry.name: ssl_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2646
entry.text: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.

entry.name: acl_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2647
entry.text: The access control list (ACL) allows or denies access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an ACL denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

entry.name: acl_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2647
entry.text: Access control list that controls accesses to the service

entry.name: aaa_policy_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2648
entry.text: Specifies the AAA Policy to use to authenticate the ebMS2 messages that are received on this handler.

entry.name: aaa_policy_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2648
entry.text: AAA policy that authenticates the received messages

entry.name: credential_charset_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2649
entry.text: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value is Protocol, which indicates ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

entry.name: credential_charset_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2649
entry.text: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values

entry.name: ssl_config_type_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2650
entry.text: The TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_config_type_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2650
entry.text: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: ssl_server_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2651
entry.text: The TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_server_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2651
entry.text: Set the TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: ssl_sni_server_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_help_2652
entry.text: The TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_sni_server_ebms2sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2652
entry.text: Set the TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: source_ebms3_kglobalconfig_help_2653
entry.text: The configuration for an ebMS3 handler.

entry.name: source_ebms3_kglobalconfig_descr_2653
entry.text: ebMS3 Handler

entry.name: admin_state_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2654
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2654
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: local_address_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2656
entry.text: The address on which the service listens. The default value of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the service is active on all addresses. Local host aliases help to ease migration tasks between machines.

entry.name: local_address_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2656
entry.text: Local IP address

entry.name: port_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2657
entry.text: Specifies the port monitored by the HTTP service. Enter a value in the range 1 - 65535. The default value is 80.

entry.name: port_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2657
entry.text: The local TCP port number that supports server operations

entry.name: http_client_version_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2658
entry.text: Select the HTTP version to use for front (client) side connection. The default is HTTP 1.1.

entry.name: http_client_version_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2658
entry.text: Front side HTTP version

entry.name: persistent_connections_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2659
entry.text: Controls whether to enable persistent connections on the front side. The default is enabled.

entry.name: persistent_connections_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2659
entry.text: Whether to enable persistent connections

entry.name: compression_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2660
entry.text: Controls whether to enable GZIP compression on the front side. The default is disabled.

entry.name: compression_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2660
entry.text: Whether to enable GZIP compression

entry.name: max_url_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2661
entry.text: An integer in the range 1 to 128000 that specifies the longest incoming URL that is accepted in bytes. The length includes any query string or fragment identifier. The default value is 16384.

entry.name: max_url_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2661
entry.text: Longest incoming URL that is accepted

entry.name: max_total_header_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2662
entry.text: Specifies the maximum aggregate size of incoming HTTP headers in bytes. Enter a value in the range 5 - 128000. The default value is 128000.

entry.name: max_total_header_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2662
entry.text: Maximum aggregate size of incoming headers

entry.name: max_header_count_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2663
entry.text: Specifies the maximum number of headers that is allowed in the request message. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_count_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2663
entry.text: Maximum number of HTTP request headers

entry.name: max_header_name_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2664
entry.text: Each HTTP Header is expressed as a name and value pair. This property specifies the maximum length of the name portion of the header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_name_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2664
entry.text: Maximum length of HTTP header name

entry.name: max_header_value_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2665
entry.text: Each HTTP Header is expressed as a name and value pair. This property specifies the maximum length of the value portion of the header. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_header_value_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2665
entry.text: Maximum length of HTTP header value

entry.name: max_querystring_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2666
entry.text: The maximum length of the query string that is allowed in the client requests. The query string is the portion of the URL after the question mark (?) character. The default value is 0, which indicates no limit.

entry.name: max_querystring_len_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2666
entry.text: Maximum query string length

entry.name: ssl_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2667
entry.text: Select an existing TLS proxy profile from the list to assign the TLS proxy profile to this handler. Click the + button to create a new TLS proxy profile and assign that TLS proxy profile to the handler.

entry.name: ssl_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2667
entry.text: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS server profile or TLS SNI server profile.

entry.name: acl_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2668
entry.text: The access control list (ACL) allows or denies access to this service based on the IP address of the client. When attached to a service, an ACL denies all access by default. To deny access to only selected addresses, first grant access to all addresses (allow 0.0.0.0) and then create deny entries for the desired hosts.

entry.name: acl_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2668
entry.text: Access control list that controls accesses to the service

entry.name: aaa_policy_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2669
entry.text: Specifies the AAA Policy to use to authenticate the ebMS3 messages that are received on this handler.

entry.name: aaa_policy_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2669
entry.text: AAA policy that authenticates the received messages

entry.name: credential_charset_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2670
entry.text: Specifies the character encoding of the original basic authentication values. Basic authentication credentials are combined and base64 encoded in the authorization header of the request. The DataPower Gateway transcodes the contents of the authorization header to UTF-8. The default value is Protocol, which indicates ISO-8859-1, Latin 1.

entry.name: credential_charset_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2670
entry.text: Character encoding of the original basic authentication values

entry.name: ssl_config_type_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2671
entry.text: The TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_config_type_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2671
entry.text: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: ssl_server_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2672
entry.text: The TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_server_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2672
entry.text: Set the TLS server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: ssl_sni_server_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_help_2673
entry.text: The TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: ssl_sni_server_ebms3sourceprotocolhandler_descr_2673
entry.text: Set the TLS SNI server profile to secure connections between clients and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: admin_state_ftpfilepollersourceprotocolhandler_help_2674
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_ftpfilepollersourceprotocolhandler_descr_2674
entry.text: Set the administrative state of this configuration.

entry.name: summary_ftpfilepollersourceprotocolhandler_descr_2675
entry.text: Brief summary for user annotation.

entry.name: max_transfers_per_poll_ftpfilepollersourceprotocolhandler_help_2676
entry.text: The number of allowed concurrent client connections in a polling sequence. Enter a value in the range 0 - 100. The value must be less than the number of simultaneous connections that the polled server accepts. The default value is 0 which means unlimited number of connections based on available system resources. To avoid the consumption of all the systems resources, enter a value other than 0.

entry.name: max_transfers_per_poll_ftpfilepollersourceprotocolhandler_descr_2676
entry.text: Maximum number of files to be transferred during each cycle of the poller connection

entry.name: admin_state_nfsfilepollersourceprotocolhandler_help_2677
entry.text: The administrative state of the configuration. To make active, set to enabled. To make inactive, set to disabled.

entry.name: admin_state_nfsfilepollersourceprotocolhandler_descr_2677
